cooking_method: Cut the chicken into small, bite-sized pieces. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce and rice wine. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Add the peanuts and scallions, and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot over rice.

In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the peas and carrots and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add the cooked rice and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Push the rice to the sides of the wok or skillet, creating a well in the center. Crack the eggs into the well and scramble them. Mix the scrambled eggs into the rice mixture. Add the green onions and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot.

In a large pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the tofu, bamboo shoots, and shiitake mushrooms, and simmer for 5-7 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar and some water. Slowly pour the mixture into the soup, stirring constantly. In a separate bowl, beat an egg. Slowly pour the egg into the soup, stirring constantly. Serve hot.

Cut the tofu into small cubes. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add the Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for another minute. Add the doubanjiang and stir-fry for another minute. Add the tofu and stir-fry for another minute. Add some water and simmer for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened. Garnish with green onions and serve hot with rice.

Mix the ground pork, scallions, ginger, and soy sauce in a bowl. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each wonton wrapper. Fold the wrapper in half and pinch the edges together to seal. Steam the dumplings in a bamboo steamer for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot with soy sauce and vinegar.

Cut the pork tenderloin into small strips. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the pork and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Add the shiitake mushrooms and stir-fry for another minute. Add the scrambled eggs and hoisin sauce, and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot with warm tortillas.

Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. In a bowl, mix together the peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, and some water to create a sauce. Drain the spaghetti and toss it with the sauce. Garnish with green onions and serve cold or at room temperature.

Cut the eggplant into small cubes. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry for another minute. Add the eggplant and stir-fry for another minute. Add some water and simmer for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened. Garnish with green onions and serve hot with rice.

Cook rice according to package instructions. Heat some oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add shrimp and stir-fry until cooked. Push shrimp to the sides of the wok, add some beaten eggs in the center and scramble them. Add frozen peas and carrots and stir-fry until heated through. Add cooked rice and soy sauce, stir-fry until everything is heated and mixed well. Serve hot.

Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add the peanut butter and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry for another minute. Add the cooked noodles and stir-fry until everything is heated and mixed well. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Marinate the duck overnight with hoisin sauce, scallions, and other spices. Roast the duck in the oven until the skin is crispy and golden brown. Slice the meat and serve with warm pancakes, sliced cucumbers, and scallions. Spread some hoisin sauce on the pancake, add some duck slices, cucumber, and scallions, and roll it up like a burrito. Enjoy!

In a pot, heat the chicken broth over high heat. Add some grated ginger and chopped green onions. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and cornstarch. Slowly pour the egg mixture into the soup while stirring the soup with a fork to create the egg ribbons. Add some salt and white pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry until cooked. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add some more oil to the wok and add the shrimp. Stir-fry until cooked. Remove the shrimp and set aside. Add more oil and stir-fry the broccoli, carrots, and water chestnuts until slightly tender. Add the chicken and shrimp back into the wok, and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot.

Slice the pork loin into thin strips. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. Add the pork and stir-fry until browned. Remove the pork and set aside. Add some more oil to the wok and stir-fry the sliced red bell pepper, snow peas, and minced garlic until slightly tender. Add the pork back into the wok, sprinkle with five-spice powder, and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot with rice.

In a large bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, honey, and lemon juice until well combined. Set aside. Heat some oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until cooked. Remove the shrimp and set aside. Add the walnuts to the wok and stir-fry until lightly toasted. Add the cooked shrimp back into the wok and pour in the honey-mayonnaise sauce. Stir-fry for another minute until the shrimp are coated with the sauce. Serve hot with rice.

Slice the beef into thin strips. In a bowl, mix together some cornstarch and soy sauce to marinate the beef for 15 minutes. Cut the broccoli into small florets. Heat some oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry until fragrant. Add the marinated beef and stir-fry until browned. Add the broccoli and stir-fry until tender. Serve hot with rice.

In a bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and water to form a dough. Knead the dough for a few minutes until smooth. Let the dough rest for 30 minutes. Slice the scallions thinly. Divide the dough into small balls, and roll each ball out into a thin circle. Brush the circle with sesame oil, and sprinkle some sliced scallions on top. Roll the circle up into a spiral, then flatten it out again with a rolling pin. Heat some oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook the pancake for a few minutes on each side until crispy and golden brown. Serve hot.

To make Tea-Smoked Duck, first marinate the duck breast with salt and pepper for at least an hour. Combine black tea leaves, brown sugar, star anise, and cinnamon in a wok and heat until it starts to smoke. Place the duck breast on a rack above the smoking mixture and cover the wok with a lid. Smoke the duck for 10-15 minutes or until it's cooked to your liking. Serve with steamed rice and stir-fried vegetables.
